channel.title: Gba-pong
channel.description:
Lately I've been working on making the classic pong game on the GameBoy Advance. The game itself isn't spectacular, but it was a great experience getting to program on hardware with significant limitations. GBA programming is alot of fun and you get tons out of it, especially when programming for performance.
https://github.com/AnthonyCalandra/gba-pong
[img width=800 height=400]http://anthony-calandra.com/downloads/gba.jpg[/img]

item.title: Gba-pong
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:12, topic:553176”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=672092.msg4497804#msg4497804 date=1445795477]
The code doesn’t seem too difficult to process, but how the hell do you even put the code into a physical GBA game? That’s really amazing
[/quote]gba/ds flashcards look exactly like a game cartridge but have a micro sd slot in it.[/quote]

Basically this.

I had to order the part off of a really sketchy Chinese website for about $20. Bought the miniSD card and adapter, and all I had to do was store the GBA file that was generated by the makefile onto the card.

Read full topic

item.title: Gba-pong
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:6, topic:553176”]Thanks for licensing this. It’s a bigger deal than you think! Having licenses ROMs that can be built with free software allows them into various Linux distro’s repositories, and removes the ‘contrib’ (free but with nonfree requirements) label from emulators.

Great work, by the way.[/quote]

Thanks dude! I really enjoy working on open-source projects so I tend to license my work in a similar way.

Read full topic

item.title: Gba-pong
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Thanks for licensing this. It’s a bigger deal than you think! Having licenses ROMs that can be built with free software allows them into various Linux distro’s repositories, and removes the ‘contrib’ (free but with nonfree requirements) label from emulators.

Great work, by the way.

Read full topic
